alert.note: Alert for Custer (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 01 at 11:46AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of western Oklahoma, including the following county, Custer. * WHEN...Until 300 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1146 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Clinton, Thomas, Arapaho, Custer City, Butler, Foss Reservoir and Stafford. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
